sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Stars: Harold Lloyd, Barbara Kent, Charles Middleton
Director: Clyde Bruckman, Malcolm St. Clair
üçïALL-TALKING THRILLSüçïMYSYERYüçïROMANCE
Silent film star HAROLD LLOYD takes a daring leap into sound with a noisy mix of botany, bad guys, and mistaken identity in San Francisco‚Äôs Chinatown! Co-starring Barbara Kent and Noah Young, this rousing crime caper marks a milestone in the fearless comedian‚Äôs career‚Äîand in Hollywood history.

TRIVIA: Welcome Danger was originally shot as a silent film. After its completion, the rapid rise of "talkies" convinced Harold Lloyd to reshoot much of it with synchronized dialogue, utilizing the Movietone sound system and hiring new director Clyde Bruckman. The transition wasn‚Äôt without its challenges, but Lloyd‚Äôs trademark charm, physical comedy, and quick adaptability helped turn Welcome Danger into one of the highest-grossing films of 1929.

metadata.Plot: Harold Bledsoe, a botany student, is called back home to San Francisco, where his late father had been police chief, to help investigate a crime wave in Chinatown.
metadata.Writer: Paul Gerard Smith, Felix Adler, Lex Neal
metadata.Actors: Harold Lloyd, Barbara Kent, Noah Young
